Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (15 ll.) and verso (2 ll.). Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Loan of corn made by Petamun son of Pilous to Panobchunis son of Tuot. Date. year 10 Mesore 10(?) of King Ptolemy - if Soter II = BC. 107 Aug. 24. if Alexander = BC 104 Aug. 23". Concerning this group of texts, see entry for P BM EA 10491.
Curator's comments: Kaplony-Heckel, U., Das Getreide-Darlehn P. Haun. Inv. Demot. 2, in K. Ryholt (ed.), Acts of the seventh international conference of Demotic studies. Copenhagen, 2002, 243.Text 18 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (C J Martin/S E Thomas). Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (314) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/314)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair
